quote: Go ahead, Commander.
Delay the departure of all vessels until further notice. We have reason to believe that someone may have tried to kill Mister Garak.
Acknowledged.
I think it's time we had a little talk with Garak...
But who would want to kill me... a simple tailor?
A simple tailor who used to be an agent of the Obsidian Order.

The Obsidian Order? Constable, you shouldn't put so much stock in Doctor Bashir's flights of fancy. Are you sure the explosion wasn't an accident, because I can't think of anyone who would wish me harm...
Someone tried to kill you, Garak, and whoever it was might try again... so if I were you, I'd give the matter some serious thought...
Well... let me see... there was that Nausicaan whose wedding suit I misplaced... and that Yridian I owe money to... and, of course, there's always Major Kira...
This is serious, Garak.
I'm being serious. I don't think she likes me.
She doesn't. But if she wanted you dead, you would be.
You do have a point.
Could this attempt on your life have anything to do with the reason you were exiled from Cardassia?
I seriously doubt the Finance Ministry would try to have me killed for failing to pay my taxes.
You expect us to believe that's the reason you were exiled?
Do you think I'd lie about a thing like that? It's not something I'm proud of.
Garak, I don't like explosions going off on my station. Innocent people could've been hurt. You could've been hurt. So if you know something you're not telling us, I suggest you start talking.
I've told you everything I can think of.
All right, then. I'll investigate the... "leads" you've given us. If you think of anyone else I should talk to, let me know.
I certainly will.
We've assigned a security detail to you. I suggest you stay as close to them as possible.
Someone should do a study...
A study?
To try and figure out why some people can't bring themselves to trust anyone, even when it's in their best interest.
Why is it that no one ever believes me, even when I'm telling the truth... ?
Have you ever heard the story of the boy who cried wolf?
No...

It's a children's story about a young shepherd boy who gets lonely while tending his flock. So he cries out to the villagers that a wolf is attacking the sheep. The people come running, but of course, there's no wolf. He claims that it's run away, and the villagers praise him for his vigilance.
Clever lad... a charming story.

I'm not finished. The next day the boy does it again, and the next day, too... on the fourth day, a wolf really comes... the boy cries out at the top of his lungs, but the villagers ignore him... and the boy and his flock are gobbled up...
That's a little graphic for children, don't you think?
But the point is that if you lie all the time, no one will believe you even if you're telling the truth.
Are you sure that's the point, Doctor?
Of course, what else would it be?
That you should never tell the same lie twice...
You wanted to see me?
I have bad news for you... Major Kira has an airtight alibi.
I thought you might want to look over the passenger manifests of ships that recently came to the station.
To see if I recognize anyone who might... wish me harm.
Exactly.
I suggest you start with the most recent arrivals and work backwards...
Don't worry about me, Constable. I can manage on my own.
I'm not about to leave you alone in here so you can look through my security files...
What makes you think I haven't already looked through them... ?
I'm joking, of course...
Of course...
I'm afraid I don't recognize any of these names...
The bomb could've been planted days ago, even weeks. I suggest you keep going back just to be sure.
This could take forever.
I would think you'd have plenty of time on your hands, now that your shop is no longer... open for business.
I finished running the biomolecular scan you asked for.
I found traces of living tissue on the bulkhead around the blast site...
It looks like the remains of a pheromonic sensor.
A what?
A sensor that's sensitive to pheromones. It's triggered when a person of a particular species gets within range.
In this case a Cardassian... me.
They're known to be favored by Flaxian assassins... -- and it just so happens that a Flaxian came aboard the station just this morning...
-- so Mister... Retaya -- your papers indicate you're a merchant.
I deal in fine wares... mostly fabrics and fragrances.
According to my information, you were a suspect in the murder of Dekora Assan, on Japori Two.
I was cleared of those charges. It was a case of mistaken identity...
This is your sample case, I take it.
Yes...
How fortunate... as it happens, I'm looking for a gift for a friend...
A... lady friend?
Exactly...
Unfortunately, I don't have a sense of smell... could you describe this fragrance for me?
It has a somewhat.. floral bouquet.
We have a Cardassian tailor here on the station named Garak. There was an explosion in his shop not long after you arrived.
I felt the blast... was he hurt?
Not seriously.
That one is more... musky than the first.
Tell me... where were you when the explosion occurred?
The Ferengi's bar... I went there as soon as I arrived this morning.
I suppose I'd have to describe that one as... spicy...
I see. And how long were you at Quark's?
The rest of the day... right up until your deputy came and brought me here.
So... have you found something for your lady friend?
Almost. I think she would like something that's both floral and musky. Perhaps if we mixed these two?
Why not?
Very nice...
On the other hand... she's also quite fond of spicy things... perhaps we should add a drop of this one as well... ?
I don't think they'll go well together...
Let's find out.
I really don't think your lady friend will like the aroma...
Much less the fact that when these three... "fragrances" are combined, they produce a gaseous mixture that can trigger a fatal heart attack when inhaled.
I had no idea...
Then why did you stop me from mixing them?
As I said, I simply didn't think your friend would like the aroma...
Unless you have anymore questions, I'd like to go now. I have deliveries to make on Cardassia.
I'll let you know when you can leave the station.
How long was the Flaxian salesman here today?
He was here all day... but he was no salesman.
What do you mean?
Oh, he had a sample case, and he made a big show of wanting everyone to see what he had inside it... but he didn't have the eyes.
The eyes?
Salesman eyes, friendly but blank... they give nothing away. You can't tell if you're being fleeced or getting the deal of your life...
(studying Quark's eyes) I think I know exactly what you're talking about...
Thank you, Doctor. What I'm saying is that it takes one to know one, and that Flaxian was no salesman. But he was a good customer. Didn't win big, didn't lose big. Now if you'll excuse me --
What time did he arrive?
About... fifteen minutes after we opened.
Are you sure he was here all day?
Until security came in and dragged him off. If you don't believe me ask Morn. They talked for hours.
Did he talk to anyone else?
I don't remember. Can I go? I have customers.
What do we do now?
That depends on Garak.
Me? What can I do?
You can start telling the truth for a change. For instance, why would this Flaxian want to kill you?
I have no idea. Maybe someone hired him to do it.
Like who?
I don't know.
Are you sure?

You seem to be under the impression that I would knowingly withhold information when my life is at stake. I can assure you, Constable, I have a well developed instinct for self- preservation. If I had anything to add, I would have done so by now.
I think he's telling the truth, Odo.
I don't. And if Mister Garak doesn't care enough about his own life to share his secrets with us, then I don't either. I'm letting the Flaxian go.
Letting him go? But he's our prime suspect.
I don't have enough evidence to hold him. And it doesn't look like I'll be getting any more in the near future. You can go.
What are you doing?
I'm canceling your security detail.
But someone may try to kill me again.
A distinct possibility. So if you change your mind and decide to be a little more cooperative, you know where to reach me. Until then... sleep well, Garak.
Everything's all set. The transponder is aboard the Flaxian's ship.
You're sure he won't find it?
Not a chance, I hid it in his ship's magneton relay. You'll be able to track him as long as you stay within half a light year. Who do you think he's going to lead you to?
If I knew that, I wouldn't have to follow him...
I was wondering when you were going to get here. The Flaxian left two minutes ago. If we're going to follow him, we're going to have to get moving.
What makes you think I'm going to follow him?
Although Doctor Bashir may have been convinced by your performance in Quark's, I happen to know that you're far too dogged an investigator to let the only suspect in the case just disappear.
Congratulations, your powers of deduction are truly astonishing...
Now if you'll kindly disembark, I'll continue my dogged investigation.
But I intend to come with you.
Forgive me, but... are you making a joke? Cardassian humor escapes me.
I'm quite serious. Believe me, having someone try to kill you is no laughing matter.
Perhaps... but I don't require your company on this trip.
My presence could be very helpful, especially if the Flaxian goes into Cardassian space.
I'm not interested in debating your usefulness to --
I hate to interrupt, but the Flaxian is getting farther away. I assume you've placed a tracking device on his ship, but if we don't get started soon he's going to get out of range.
Rio Grande to Ops... request permission to depart.
Permission granted.
Trust me, Constable. I can be a most pleasant traveling companion. And this promises to be a very interesting trip.
The tracking device is working perfectly...
If I'm reading this correctly, and I'm no expert, it looks like the Flaxian ship is about to go into warp...
It would seem that our "interesting" trip has just been cut short...
According to our sensor logs, the Flaxian ship exploded the moment its warp drive was engaged.
Was there a malfunction?
I thought so at first. But then I analyzed the telemetry from the transponder I planted aboard the Flaxian ship.
Just before the explosion, there's an interference pattern in the transponder's signal.
This interference could have been caused by a forced neutrino inversion...
The Romulans... They use neutrino inverters in their explosive devices...
Why would the Romulans want to destroy the Flaxian's ship?
One possibility is that the Romulans hired the Flaxian to kill Garak... and then killed the Flaxian after he failed in his mission.
Do you have any evidence of that?
It's only supposition, but it does fit the available facts.
All right, Mister Garak. Do you know why the Romulans might hire someone to kill you?
I have no idea...
I'm getting tired of hearing you say that. How long do you expect us to believe --
He's telling the truth, Commander. He doesn't know why the Romulans would try to kill him.
What makes you so sure?
Because if he did know, he'd already be spinning out an elaborate web of lies to cover up the truth...
The truth... is usually just an excuse for a lack of imagination...
If you want to know what the Romulans have against me, you'll have to ask them.
I intend to. But I don't expect them to be entirely forthcoming.
Yes, we destroyed the Flaxian's ship.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: I have to say I'm a little surprised to hear you admit it so easily.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Why should we hide it? Retaya was wanted for crimes against the Romulan Empire. His execution was perfectly legal.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: May I ask what crimes he committed?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Smuggling, counterfeiting, dealing in stolen property... I'll transmit a record of his offenses to you immediately.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Thank you...
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: We've been told that he may have worked as an assassin.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: I have nothing to corroborate that... though it wouldn't surprise me.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Not long after he came here, someone tried to kill a Cardassian who lives aboard the station.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: That would be... Mister Garak. A cobbler, I believe...
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: A tailor, actually.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: I'll correct our records. That is, if he's still alive... ?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: He is.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Well... is there anything else?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Just one more thing. How long had the Tal Shiar been looking for Retaya?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Nearly a year. Why?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Isn't it curious that you finally caught up with him here, just hours after he attempted to kill Mister Garak.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: We're just grateful to have found him at all. Now if you're finished, Commander, I have other matters to attend to.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: I take it you don't believe her either...
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: No...
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: But the question still remains, why would the Romulans want to have Garak killed?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: I don't know... -- considering those uniforms of theirs, you'd think they'd appreciate a good tailor...
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: So where does this leave your investigation?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: At a standstill. We don't know that the Romulans hired the Flaxian... we don't even know that it was Retaya who tried to kill Garak. All we do know is that a bomb went off in Garak's shop.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: All right, then let's start with him.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: What do we know about Garak? He was exiled from Cardassia... for what reason, we're not sure. He never leaves the station... he avoids contact with other Cardassians. And it's possible he was once an intelligence agent of the Obsidian Order.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: A very strong possibility, Commander.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Agreed. So isn't it reasonable to assume that the attempt on his life had something to do with the order?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Unfortunately, he's rather uncooperative when it comes to answering questions about his past.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: And the Obsidian Order is uncooperative when it comes to answering questions about their former agents.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Ordinarily, yes.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: What do you mean?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: I have certain... resources in the Cardassian Government.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: I take it you don't want to elaborate on that?
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: I'd rather not. But I would like the use of a runabout.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Granted.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Thank you, sir.
scene: 20   INT. COMMANDER'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: Stop there.
Where are you?
Nearby. I've changed my appearance since we last saw each other... I don't want you to see me.
I need some information.
Is this about the tailor's shop?
Yes...
I didn't do it.
That wasn't going to be my question. I think the Romulans tried to kill Garak.
Very good, Odo. I see working for the Bajorans hasn't entirely dulled your instincts.
My question is why.
You'd have to ask the Romulans. But I do know that you're investigating a very insignificant piece of a much larger puzzle.
What do you mean?

There's been a great deal of unusual Romulan activity in the last few weeks. Cloaked ships believed to be warbirds have been detected near the Cardassian border... troop movements... communications activity...
Sounds like they're preparing for an invasion.
It's occurred to us. And we're ready for it if it happens. But it doesn't make any sense.
Does war ever make sense?
Still the wry observer of humanoid folly... tell me, do you still do the Cardassian neck trick?
No... I don't.
Pity... you were so good at it. Garak isn't the only former operative in the Order who had an "unfortunate incident" yesterday. But he was the luckiest. The other five didn't survive.
Five operatives were killed yesterday?
Killed? No... Three died of "natural causes"... and the other two perished in "accidents."
Quite a coincidence.
If you believe in coincidence.
So you think the Romulans had something to do with their deaths.
There were certain... indications of their involvement.
That still leaves us with the question of why?
Those are the names of the dead operatives. I suggest you show them to Garak and ask him that question.
I'll do that.
I trust you agree that this information satisfies my debt to you.
Agreed.
However... if you do learn anything from your tailor and you wish to... share it with me... I'd be indebted to you again.
I'll consider it.
They're all dead... ?
I take it you're not going to mourn their passing.
Quite the contrary. In fact, under different circumstances I'd be celebrating tonight.
So you did know them?
Oh, yes. We were all quite well acquainted.
In the Obsidian Order.
Now, Constable, we've been down this road before. Why do you insist --
I've had enough of your dissembling, Garak.
I'm not Doctor Bashir and we're not sparring amiably over lunch. You pulled me into this investigation and now you're going to cooperate.
Pulled you in, I don't know what you're --
You blew up your own shop, Garak.
Well... I don't think I've ever seen that particular expression on your face before. Is it... surprise?
As a matter of fact, Constable, it is. I'm surprised that you would come to such an unlikely conclusion.

Drop the pretense, I've known ever since I spoke with the Flaxian. Assassins don't like to vary their methods and he was planning to poison you... I think you spotted him aboard the station, and blew up your shop so that I'd begin an investigation.
That seems like a very elaborate way of getting you involved. If I needed your help I could've asked for it.
But you couldn't be sure I'd take you seriously. Or that I'd help you. Besides, I think you secretly enjoyed destroying your shop.
I will admit that watching it burn wasn't exactly... tragic.
Whether you want to admit it or not, you've pulled me into this case and now you're stuck with me. I want to know who these men are and what their connection is to you.
We were all associates of Enabran Tain...
Enabran Tain... the former head of the Obsidian Order.
He retired some years ago... He was, I might add, the only head of the agency ever to live long enough to do so... For a time, we were his most trusted advisors.
Do you have any idea why the Romulans would want you all dead?
I don't know... but Tain might.
That is, if he didn't suffer an unfortunate "accident" as well...
That is a distinct possibility.
May I use your communications system?
By all means.
That's an interesting way of scrambling a signal...
I thought you might appreciate it on an aesthetic level... here we are...
Mila...
Elim... I never thought I'd see your face again...
Neither did I. I need to speak with Tain, it's urgent.
You can't. He's not here.
Where is he?
I don't know... He left yesterday in a great hurry... he wouldn't tell me where.
Maybe he realized someone was coming after him...
He's in trouble, isn't he? You have to help him, Elim. I know you're still bitter about what happened between you, but you must help him...
If you speak with him, tell him to contact me.
I promise...
I'll need a runabout, Constable...
We'll need a runabout. I'm coming with you...
I hope you know what you're doing, Garak.
So do I.
Is there anything you need me to do while you're gone?
Like what... ?
I don't know. Any unfinished business, or...
Actually, Doctor, there is something.
What?

If you go into my quarters and examine the bulkhead next to the replicator, you'll notice there's a false panel. Behind that panel is a compartment containing an isolinear rod. If I don't return within seventy-eight hours... I want you to take that rod and eat it.
Eat it? You're joking.
Yes, Doctor. I am.
Very funny.
I thought so. The answer to your question is no, Doctor, there's nothing you can do for me while I'm away.
These are yours...
The Delavian chocolates... But, Doctor, these were for you...
I know... but I thought you might need them more than I do...
Thank you...
Good luck.
We've cleared the station... if you'll be kind enough to let me know where we're going, I'll set a course.
Head for the Cardassian border... we're going to the third planet in the Unefra System.
How do you know that's where Tain's gone?
I don't. But he has a safe-house there... no one's supposed to know about it... -- especially me.
We should reach Unefra in... -- three point two hours.
That woman, Mila. Who is she?
She's been Tain's housekeeper and confidant for over thirty years.
She seemed almost... fond of you.
Is it so hard to believe that there's one person in the galaxy who regards me with a certain affection?
I could believe there's one... but I wouldn't expect it to be someone who works for Enabran Tain. It's my understanding that the two of you didn't part on the best of terms.
You could say that. Tain is directly responsible for my being exiled from Cardassia.
Then I don't understand...
Why I'm risking my life to help him?
Exactly.
I can see how it would be puzzling.
All right... you owe him something.
A logical deduction. I can see why you're the constable.
But it's more than that. He means something to you... something personal.
Now you've moved from deduction to supposition.
Not at all. You're not the kind of man who would go to such lengths simply to repay a debt.
Are you saying I have no sense of honor?

That remains to be seen. But as you said before, you also have a well developed instinct for self- preservation. You wouldn't risk going into Cardassian space for just anyone. It would have to be someone important to you... someone you cared about.

I think you were more than Tain's advisor... I think you were his protege. And he was your mentor. That is, until he sent you into exile... and yet, despite that, you still care enough about him to risk your life for him. Or is this all just... supposition?
A very interesting analysis... very interesting. Particularly coming from you.
Oh?

It's been my observation that you act solely out of a sense of justice... or at least what you consider justice. There's no feeling behind what you do, no emotion beyond a distaste for loose ends and disorder.
You don't know what it means to care about someone, do you? People are just interesting creatures to you... to be studied and analyzed.
Is there a point to all this?
Just that I find it interesting that you'd ascribe feelings and motivations to me that you personally know nothing about.
Or am I wrong? Tell me, is there one person in this universe that you care about? One person that is more to you than just an interesting puzzle to be solved. Is there, Odo... anyone?
If there were, I certainly wouldn't tell you...
And that... would be a wise decision.
I'm taking us out of warp... we're approaching the Unefra system...
What's that?
I'm detecting a subspace energy surge directly above us... a vessel of some kind is decloaking...
It's a Romulan warbird...
In Cardassian space?
They've locked onto us with a tractor beam... Take the helm, I'm going to try and send out a distress signal...
I can't pull away... the tractor lock is too strong...
They're jamming our transmission.
Do you think you got through?
I don't know. I'm going to hail them and see what they want.
I think we're about to find out...
Tain...
Hello, Garak... it's good of you to come. It spares me the trouble of having to send someone else to kill you...
Come in, come in...
It's been a long time, Elim...
So... you're a tailor, now. Is this one of your creations?
A minor example of my work...
I'm not sure I like the neckline...
You always did have a keen sense of fashion. But it seems you've let it go... along with your once-trim figure.
Constable Odo, I've always wanted to meet you.
I wish I could say the same...
Come now... haven't you ever been the least bit curious about me... about my relationship with Garak... our work in the Obsidian Order?
I seldom waste time speculating about retired spymasters and their associates...
He's good. He hides his true feelings almost as well as you do, Elim. He'd have made a good operative, in the old days.

I've had the same thought myself. But then, those days are long gone. At least they are for me. You, on the other hand, seem to have left your retirement far behind. Unless you're simply on a pleasure cruise with your pointed-eared friends.

Cunning, isn't he? He makes a racial slur within earshot of two Romulans, putting me in the position of either having to defend them -- and thus giving away my allegiance to them -- or letting the comment pass... in which case he's managed to plant a seed of discord between us.
Frankly, I don't find any of this interesting. You both go to such lengths to hide the true meaning of your words that you end up saying nothing.
I think you'll find that when I have something to say, you won't have any trouble understanding it.

To answer your question, Garak, I'm not on a pleasure cruise. This ship is part of a fleet of Romulan and Cardassian vessels... a fleet which will soon be traveling through the wormhole into the Gamma Quadrant.
I take it you're not on a mission of peaceful exploration...
Not exactly...
You're going to attack the Dominion, aren't you... ? You're going to stage a first strike against them, before they can come into the Alpha Quadrant.
A clear and precise analysis. Commander Sisko must find you a valuable advisor.
It's a daring plan... I didn't think there was anyone in the Central Command bold enough to take on the Dominion.
Who said anything about the Central Command? This is a joint operation between the Obsidian Order and the Tal Shiar. We've been building a fleet of ships in the Orias System for months now.
If you attack the Dominion they'll certainly strike back. You'll be taking Romulus and Cardassia into war... a war you may not win.
I don't think they'll be striking back. We intend to wipe out the Dominion in a single blow... by eliminating the Founders. Without them, the Dominion will collapse.
You seem disturbed by that, changeling... why? After all, you've turned your back on your people.
You seem to know a great deal about me... and "my people."
We know everything you know... including the location of their homeworld.
Starfleet has shared its intelligence on the Dominion with the Romulans...
And the Romulans have shared it with me.
You'll forgive me if I reduce the scope of this conversation to something a little more personal.
Why was it necessary to kill me, and the rest of our former associates, before embarking on this... excursion into the Gamma Quadrant?
Because, Garak, I don't plan on going back into retirement when this is over. I plan on going back to my old job, and my old life.
And you were afraid we knew things about you... things that could be used against you. So you decided to have us eliminated.
Like I used to say... always burn your bridges behind you... you never know who might be trying to follow.
You also used to say that the Tal Shiar was sloppy. You shouldn't have relied on them to burn your bridges.
True... they should never have hired the Flaxian to blow up your shop...
Actually, I blew up my shop. It was a way of piquing the good constable's interest.
You blew up your own shop... You, my friend, are a true original. If you hadn't betrayed me, things would have been very different.
I never betrayed you!
At least... not in my heart.
Why do you think I'm here? I came because I thought the Romulans were trying to kill you... I came here to save you...
I never thought I'd hear myself say this, Garak... but, I believe you. You can go...
Excuse me... ?
The changeling has to stay, of course, but you're free to go. Your runabout is in Launching Bay Three.
Just like that?
Just like that.
Aren't you concerned that I'll warn Starfleet and the Central Command about your plans?
It's too late. The Central Command will have a war on their hands, whether they want one or not. And as for Starfleet, this isn't their fight, they won't interfere.
It's a trick, Garak. After all this, he's not going to just let you walk away.
It's not a trick, it's a choice. You can walk out that door, or you can join me.
Join you... ?
That is what you've been waiting for, isn't it? To end your exile, to come back into the fold. I'm giving you the chance to serve Cardassia again... at my side.
You'll pardon me if I appear a little startled... but are you saying all is forgiven?
I can't forgive what you did... but I can try to forget... put it aside as if it never happened.
So... do you want to go back to your shop and hem pants... or shall we pick up where we left off?
Garak, this is the man who put you into exile, the man who two days ago tried to have you killed...
Yes, he is... and it doesn't matter... I'm back...
The Cardassians are still closing... they have powered their weapons systems --
They have established weapons lock...
Weapons lock broken...
Going to warp...
Get out of here, Jake, I'm in the middle of a simulation...
Computer, end program...
You okay --
Look what you made me do!
You should know not to end a program sitting down.
What did you come in here for?
You were supposed to meet me half an hour ago.
I didn't realize it'd gotten so late. Sorry.
Don't worry about it... how's it going, anyway?
Pretty good... I've improved my reaction time by almost twenty percent... I've got to get it up another five...
Is that the cutoff point for getting into the Academy Preparatory Program?
Exactly...
If I don't get into the program, I'll never be admitted to the Academy next year.
You think six weeks of summer classes will make the difference?
If I do well. I have to show the admissions committee how determined I am to become a cadet.
Don't worry so much, Nog... you're going to be a great cadet.
But in the meantime, you make a lousy stockboy...
Why can't you take after your friend here? He knows enough to stay out of Starfleet. Even a human can see that there are a lot more profitable opportunities out there for a young man with ambition.
Uncle, he wants to be a writer. There's no profit in that.
On the contrary. Writing holosuite programs... (a wink and a nudge to Jake) -- especially the more... intimate variety -- is very profitable...
I'll bet...
Tell you what. The two of you come up with a proposal, and I'll put up the latinum for your first program.
I don't think so, Uncle...

Fine. Join Starfleet. I don't know why I bother trying to help you, anyway. Go down to the storeroom and get your father, tell him to get behind the bar. (straightening his clothes) Lieutenant Dax has asked me to join the senior staff for a very important meeting in the wardroom.
Do you have any idea what Dax wants to talk to us about?
No...
Apparently she asked Leeta to come as well...
I've noticed they've been spending quite a bit of time together...
Do you keep tabs on everyone, Constable... ?
Not everyone... But really, Doctor, two Delvin fluff pastries for breakfast this morning...
You of all people should know better than to start your day like that...
Thank you all for coming... I'll get right to the point... you're the seven people on this station I feel closest to... and I want you all to be a part of my zhian'tara...
Zhian'tara... what's that?
It's the Trill Rite of Closure... I've read about it...
The zhian'tara is a ritual where joined Trills get the chance to actually meet their previous hosts...
Meet them? How?
That's where you come in... If you don't mind, I'd like to borrow your bodies for a few hours...
What do you mean... "borrow" our bodies?

If you agree to participate, the memories of one of my previous hosts will be temporarily removed from the symbiont and imprinted onto you... you'll essentially become one of my hosts for the duration of the ritual.
How is this accomplished?
The memories are transferred telepathically by a Guardian.
A Guardian... ?
They take care of the symbionts... usually they're unjoined Trills.
Leeta is sort of an amateur sociologist.
It comes in handy in my line of work... You never know who you'll meet at the dabo table...
You're asking me to hand my body over to some... dead person?
Just for a few hours...
What happens to "me" in the meantime?
You'll remain conscious of what's going on around you... you can reassert yourself and regain control of your body at any time.

But it's best if you relax and let the host's memories emerge... the point is to give Jadzia the chance to interact with her previous hosts. Curzon spoke very fondly of his zhian'tara... he said it was one of the most powerful experiences of his life...
I do have one question... what about Joran?
Joran... ? Was he that... (twirling a finger near his temple in the universal sign for crazy) -- crazy host of yours? The musician who killed someone?
Commander Sisko has volunteered to embody Joran.
We've already discussed taking certain... precautions during the transference.
Well... I'm in.
Me, too.
Why's everyone looking at me... ?
Because you're the only one who hasn't agreed to participate.
I'm sorry, Lieutenant. But you're going to have to find someone else.
I really want you to be a part of this, Quark... I was hoping you'd embody Audrid for me...
Well...
I think it would bring us closer together...
When you put it that way...
I knew I could count on you...
Kira, I want you to embody Lela, my first host... we'll start tomorrow after the Guardian arrives...
It means a lot to me that you're all willing to do this... Thank you...
Correct me if I'm wrong, but did Quark just agree to embody one of your female hosts?
Yes, he did.
-- after that comes the deductive reasoning portion of the exam, and then the spatial orientation test. The whole thing'll take about four days.
I know it must sound overwhelming to you... just try to take it one day at a time.
One day at a time... right.
And today, all you have to worry about is the stress reaction test. Computer, run program delta five nine.
I thought this was going to be a runabout simulation...
No...
But... that's what I practiced...
If we tested you where you practiced it wouldn't exactly be stressful, would it?
Man your post... you're the Operations Officer on duty...
What was that?
You tell me...
We've been trying to get Dax back to the homeworld to perform the zhian'tara for some time now... She kept putting us off, so the Symbiosis Commission decided to force the issue and send me here.
I just haven't had the time to get away...
You could've made the time.
Where will the zhian'tara take place? I have preparations to make.
I'nora, ja'kala Dax... zhian'shee, Lela tanus rem... Gon'dar, Jadzia tor...
Jadzia, zhian'tara vok... Tu Dax, zhian'tani ress... Zhian'par, Lela garu'koj...
Kira... ?
No... Lela...
You must be Dax's new host...
I'm Jadzia...
What a beautiful name...
I have a few questions for both of you... I need to make sure the memory transference is complete...
Go ahead...
What is the last thing you remember?
Talking to Curzon at his zhian'tara...
Can you tell me the name of the person who supervised Lela when she was an Initiate?
No... I can't remember...
That's perfectly all right. It just means Lela's memories have been temporarily removed from your mind.
It's... a little disorienting... like part of me is suddenly missing.
Not missing... Right here... And the name of my Initiate supervisor was Jobel...
Excellent. The transference seems to be complete... unless either of you has any questions, I'll leave you alone for a few hours...
Thank you...
Such odd fellows, these Guardians...
I know...
It's understandable, I suppose... after all, they spend most of their time living underground -- -- tending to symbiont pools full of this stuff...
I love the way it smells, don't you?
It looks like you ended up a long way from home, Jadzia...
What is it... ?
It's just... I sometimes hold my hands behind my back the same way you do...

It's a habit I picked up when I was a Legislator... I was one of the first women to ever serve as a council member, and when I started out, I would speak with my hands -- lots of emphatic gesturing... I found out that some of my male colleagues were doing imitations of me, so I started doing this.
I thought it was just an unconscious habit... I never realized why I did it...
That's the point of the zhian'tara... to discover these kinds of things about yourself...
This is all so strange... it's like you really are Lela...
In a sense I am. After all, what is a person if not the sum of their memories... ?
I have a feeling these next few days are going to be very interesting for you...
Tobin, I don't think Chief O'Brien is going to appreciate you biting his nails...
Sorry... I guess I'm a little nervous...
That's all right... I get that way sometimes myself...
Now you know who you have to thank for it... Sorry.
Will you please stop saying you're sorry?
Sorry.
I've been working on finishing your proof of Fermat's last theorem...
You have?
It's the most original approach to the proof since Wiles over three hundred years ago...
Thanks...
I guess I tend to look for original approaches myself. Maybe I have you to thank for that, as well.
The thing you've got to remember when you're trying to normalize the equations is --
Very nice...
This is an excellent body you managed to get for me.
I'll be sure and pass that on...
I remember when I first got the Dax symbiont I was worried that it would affect my coordination in some way...
And hurt your gymnastics career...
As it turned out, being joined improved my concentration...
I found that as well.
You're a gymnast?
No... but I'm an expert in Klingon martial arts...
Did you take it up before or after you were joined?
After.
Why am I not surprised... ?
Show me some Klingon defense moves.
Sit right here and I'll tell you all about it.
The day I was named head of the Symbiosis Commission was one of the happiest of my life... right behind the day I gave birth to my first child. Are you a mother, Jadzia... ?
No...
Well I hope you will be someday... there's nothing quite like holding a baby to your breast and nursing it...
The entity who lent me this body wishes to speak...
How much longer am I going to have to do this?
Another hour at most...
The sooner we get back to it the sooner it'll be over.
Just remember, not a word about this to anyone...
I promise...
Maybe you should go easy on those, Torias... Julian told me the other day that he's started watching what he eats...
Tell your friend he should live a little... life's too short to deprive yourself of the simple pleasures... I should know...
You didn't exactly deprive yourself.
No, but my life was too short.
The accident...
Still, I'm lucky... I continue to exist as part of you. Just like Jadzia will go on existing when the symbiont is passed to a new host.
We're part of something bigger than any one of us... I feel very lucky to have been chosen...
So do I...
Come in...
It's late... I think it's time we returned Doctor Bashir's body to him...
It was nice meeting you...
I'm ready...
Are you sure about this, Commander?
Don't worry, Odo. Joran's not going to be able to hurt anyone from inside a holding cell.
There's just one problem... you're going to be in there with him...
Activate the forcefield...
Joran... ?
Hello, Jadzia...
If you need me, I'll be right outside...
As will I...
It's good to see you again, Jadzia...
Tell me... have you been practicing your music?
Yes... when I have the time...
Good... do you think of me when you play?
Sometimes.
I'm glad.
How has your zhian'tara gone so far... ?
You're lucky... they took the symbiont from me before I had the chance to have my zhian'tara...
What do you think of your previous hosts... ? I'm sure they're an impressive group...
Yes... they are...
You're a very pretty girl, Jadzia... very pretty...
But unfortunately that's all you are... compared to Lela, Torias or myself, you're nothing. A pretender. You must realize that by now.
You don't know anything about me...
Only what I can see. A little girl who's not worthy of the noble creature nestled inside her... you're overwhelmed by it... you're in over your head.
And they said choosing me for joining was a mistake.
There's only one hope for you, Jadzia... and that's me... my strength is within you... you don't have to be afraid of it...
I'm not.
Then use it... let me show you how to use it... Lower the forcefield...
Lower it, and you'll never be afraid of anything ever again...
No...
Stop it, you're hurting him...
Benjamin!
Benjamin, take control!
I think we've had enough of Joran for now...
Are you all right... ?
Surprise...
It's all right, old man... it's me...
Thanks...
For what?
For not breaking any bones...
Will you stop that! I'm trying to do the books.
I can't help it... my son's future is being decided at this very minute...
Well, pacing around like some Alvanian cave sloth isn't going to help him.
What's that?
A cadet's uniform... I got it for Nog...
I had Garak make it to order. It cost five strips of latinum.
You wasted your money, he's not going to need it.
Why not?
Because... he'll be issued a uniform if and when he gets into the Academy.
Well... now he'll have two...
I keep thinking about Joran...
I heard what he said to you...
I can't seem to get it out of my head...
Jadzia... did you put off having your zhian'tara because you were afraid that you wouldn't measure up to the other hosts... ?
I don't know... maybe I did...
Now that it's almost over, I hope you realize you were wrong...
I'm not so sure I was...
I don't understand how you can say
If that's true, then why did Curzon wash me out of the Initiate program?
I don't know. You tell me.
I've always believed it was because he wanted to challenge me... so that I'd reapply and try harder... but now I'm not so sure.
Why not? That's exactly what you did.
Maybe Curzon just didn't think I was good enough.
I find that hard to believe. But if that's what you're afraid of, why don't you ask him about it?
I will... but what happens if he tells me something I don't want to hear... ?
I have to go...
Dax, zhian'tani ress... Zhian'par, Odo garu'koj...
It's not working... I'm starting to think you may have to get someone else...
No...
Jadzia, zhian'tara vok... Tu Dax, zhian'tani ress... Zhian'par, Odo garu'koj...
I'm going to my office for a while...
Benjamin!
Curzon... ?
Don't tell me... (showing off his profile) The nose gave me away...
What's the matter... aren't you happy to see me?
Of course... but... where's Jadzia... ?
It's all right... I told her I wanted to come see you, and that we'd meet at Quark's later... I'm going to give that little toad the scare of his life...
Now you sound like Odo...
I am Odo...
I don't understand... I thought you were Curzon.

I'm both... the Guardian thinks it has something to do with my shape- shifting nature... it's as if Odo and Curzon have been... joined. It's proving to be an interesting experience for both of us. In any case, the Guardian says it's nothing to worry about. I like the beard, by the way...
Yeah... ?
Absolutely...
I'm thinking of growing one, too...
Good luck...
So... when is Kasidy Yates coming back?
Not you, too...
She's a fine looking woman, Ben. Kind of reminds me of that girl you took up with on Pelios Station... the one who could --
Why don't we go join Jadzia in Quark's and let Jake finish his homework?
(a wink to Jake, as he EXITS) I'll tell you all about it later...
Odo, what happened to your face?
Never mind my face, Quark.
Did I ever mention that you're a magnificent scoundrel... Two Tronyas please, very cold...
Right away...
It's going to take Quark a long time to get over that...
Jadzia!
I see the two of you are having a good time...
As good a time as two gentlemen can have without the company of a lady... please, join us...
Excuse me while I slip into something more appropriate...
I love being a changeling...
Well... if you two don't mind, I think I'll be pushing off...
Don't go, Benjamin.
I need to finish evaluating Nog's test results. He's waiting to hear how he did.
Thanks for coming by, old man... it was good to see you...
There goes the best friend I ever had...
So... have you been enjoying your zhian'tara?
For the most part.
What about that Tobin, eh? Did he mention that I got him drunk for the first time during my zhian'tara?
No... but I can see why you did it...
Curzon... there's something I want to talk to you about.
Oh?
Do you remember when I was an Initiate... ?
Do you see that Ferengi over there... ?
A bulletin came in on him last week. He's a tongo hustler... I'd love to clean him out... We should get a game going.
I just don't understand how I could have failed, Father...
You've always been so good with spatial orientation... Remember the time we redid the floors, and you managed to stack all the chairs so they fit behind the bar... ?
Now I won't qualify to take the Academy entrance exam... my Starfleet career is over before it even started.
He's right, you know...
And it isn't fair. Starfleet has no idea who it's passing up...
You would've made a good officer, Nog...
I want you to know something... there'll always be a place for you here at Quark's.
Sorry, Lonzo...
Excuse me, folks... but we've been closed for over an hour now. I asked you nicely before, but if you don't leave, I'm going to have to call security.
I am security...
Don't worry, Quark... we're going...
I confiscated this from a Yridian smuggler...
Don't you need it for evidence?
I still want to talk to you about what happened when I was an Initiate.
I know you do... what did you want to ask me... ?
Why didn't you object when you heard I'd been reinstated into the program?
I don't know, Jadzia... maybe I decided I'd been too hard on you...
It was your job to be hard on Initiates.
Yes, but... The truth is... I felt sorry for you...
You wanted to be joined so badly... you were so young... so lovely...

I guess I've always had the nagging feeling that I didn't have your complete confidence. I tried to put it aside... but now it turns out I was right... you never thought I was good enough to be a host.
Whatever I may have thought doesn't matter. You are a host... isn't that enough?
No, it isn't. I feel like I don't have your respect. And I'm afraid that when your memories are restored to me, I'm going to feel like I don't respect myself.
In that case you'll be happy to know that I've come to a decision that's going to benefit both of us.
What do you mean?
I've decided to stay where I am... in this body...
And I'm not just speaking as Curzon... this is Odo's decision, as well. We like what we've become... and neither of us wants to go back to the way things were...
There's no way to remove Curzon's memories from Odo without his cooperation. He has to give them up willingly.
What'll happen to Jadzia if we can't persuade him to?
It'll take some time for her to adjust to the new balance... but she'll be fine.
Do you want me to talk to Curzon? I know him better than anyone. I might be able to convince him to cooperate.
I don't think so... I'm not sure I want to do anything...
What do you mean?
I mean I'm all right... and Curzon and Odo are obviously well suited to each other. Maybe this is for the best.
I'd like to speak to Jadzia alone for a moment...
You once told me that Curzon intimidated you... Something tells me he still does...
Maybe you're right. Maybe that's why it's hard for me to challenge his decisions.

Let me tell you something about Curzon. He was my friend, he was my confidant. And in a way, he was my teacher, as well. But he could also be manipulative, selfish and arrogant. Most people let him get away with it because he was so charming. Sometimes I let him get away with it. But every once and a while he'd push me too far and I'd have to stand up to him, tell him he crossed the line.
And how would he react?
Sometimes he'd just laugh and admit it, sometimes he'd get furious. But either way he'd back off, because deep down he knew he was wrong.
And he's wrong now. He's being selfish... and he's manipulated you into going along with what he wants. Now you can either let him get away with it, or you can confront him. It's up to you.
I know what you did.
Take it easy... what's wrong with you...
You know what's wrong. You reconfigured the holosuite so that Nog would fail the spatial orientation test...
Rom, I did it for his own good. I couldn't just stand by and watch my nephew throw his life away.
You had no right to interfere. I've already told Commander Sisko what you did and he's going to let Nog retake the test.
You what?
You heard me. And if you ever do anything to hurt Nog again, I'll burn the bar to the ground.
You wouldn't dare.
Yes, I would. My son's happiness is more important to me than anything, even latinum. Remember that... brother.
Jadzia... ! Good to see you. I was just... oozing around the room. You have no idea what a liberating experience it is to be in a liquid state...
We need to talk.
All right... What is it you want to talk about?
I want my memories back.
I'm sorry. I realize this is difficult for you, but you'll get over it. Trust me, it's better this way.
For you, maybe. You and Odo. You're both living out a life you never could have had otherwise. But it's my life you're living... those should be my memories.
Not anymore... and maybe they never should've been...
That's where you're wrong. I earned the right to be joined. I'm the only person in our planet's history who was ever readmitted to the Initiate program after being washed out.
The only reason you got back in is because I felt sorry for you...
Curzon Dax was famous for rejecting Initiates. Why feel sorry for me?
Don't take that tone of voice with me, little girl.
You can't intimidate me, Curzon... I'm not a little girl anymore.
No... I don't suppose you are... and the truth is you weren't a little girl back when you were an Initiate. You were a beautiful young woman... very beautiful...
You... were in love with me...

At first I thought it was just an old man's passing infatuation... After all, I'd always had an eye for the ladies... but then as we spent more time together, I started to realize that it was something more...
Then... why were you so hard on me?
I couldn't let you know the truth. You were an Initiate, I was your supervisor...
So you washed me out of the program...
Later I realized that I'd robbed you of something you'd wanted all your life... I felt so guilty I nearly retired from the Symbiosis Commission...
So when I reapplied to the program, you didn't object...
The truth is I was grateful that you'd reapplied... it let me off the hook...
So now that you know... you can see why it's best for both of us that I stay here, in this body...
Why? Because you loved me... ?
Because I still love you...
Curzon, there's no shame in that...
Yes, there is... and if we're joined, you'll feel it, too.
No... I won't. Because I love you... you're part of me, and I want you back...
That way, Jadzia and Curzon can be together, the way they should be... through Dax...
He's coming, he's coming.
Ladies and gentlemen, I'd like to introduce Starfleet's future... My son Nog.
Congratulations...
Thank you, sir...
We're proud of you...
Way to go.
Looks good on you...
But I'm afraid you jumped the gun putting on that uniform...
I know I haven't earned the right to wear it yet... but my father got it for me...
Hopefully, you'll put it on again next year.
When you ace the Academy entrance exam.
Something wrong, Chief?
It just occurred to me... once that kid gets out of the Academy, I'm going to have to start calling him "sir."
What can I get you, Nog?
A root beer... (off Quark's blank expression) It's an Earth drink... something they serve at the Academy...
Root beer... This is the end of Ferengi civilization...
May I join you, Lieutenant... ?
Of course...
I just wanted to apologize for my behavior while I was joined with Curzon...
There's no need to apologize. In a way I'm glad it happened... It forced me to deal with some things about myself I'd never really faced.
Besides, you've given me a very special gift...
Oh?
You see... now I have Curzon's memories of what it felt like to be
And I never realized how much joy you humanoids take in things like eating and drinking... or staying up all night playing tongo.
Frankly, I don't see how Curzon ever managed to get any work done.
He always seemed to, somehow...
He must've been a remarkable man...
Yes... he is...
Raimus isn't going to be happy about this.
What are you going to do?
I don't know. And don't you mean what are we going to do?
Raimus told you to get the merchandise.
I'll figure something out.
You'd better.
I said I'd figure it out. I'm hungry.
Let's have Krellan food.
Last time it gave me heartburn.
That's because you eat too fast.
I eat when I'm hungry. And when I'm hungry, I eat fast.
If you're not careful, that appetite of yours will kill you someday.
Don't get your hopes up.
We're using that.
Order some Nozala wraps.
I've accessed the system...
Tell them to deliver extra Vilm sauce.
Who should I bill this to?
I don't care who pays, as long as it isn't us.
How about... -- the police?
No, we billed them for dinner last night.
Municipal Sanitation? Do you have their account code?
I will in a minute.
Krole.
Don't -- He's being spiked.
Are you all right?
That hurt.
They spiked him. Somebody spiked him over a free lunch. What is this city coming to?
Look at this. Fused.
Too bad. That's an expensive piece of hardware.
What are we going to do?
Don't you mean what is Krole going to do?
I can't go to Raimus and ask him to pay for a replacement.
Mind if I have look?
It might not be as bad as it seems...
Are you saying you can fix it?
That depends.
On what?
How much are you willing to pay?
Do you know who I am?
No.
If you did, you wouldn't be asking that.
All right, then. Who are you?
Listen, Mister... ?
Connelly.

I've seen you around the last few weeks. You're always in here tinkering with one piece of junk or another, which tells me that things aren't exactly going too well for you. So here's my advice -- (handing him the dataport) Take this and bring it back here tomorrow morning fixed and polished.
Tomorrow morning it is.
Come on. Let's get some lunch...
Bilby wants me to fix this for him.
I'm impressed. I don't think anyone's ever managed to make contact with the Orion Syndicate so quickly. How'd you do it?
I spiked one of Bilby's men while he was interfacing.
That was a risky thing to do.
Maybe. But it got me noticed. I want to get this mission over with so I can go home.
I realize you didn't exactly volunteer for this. Believe me, I wish we hadn't been forced to turn to someone outside Starfleet Intelligence for help.
Me, too.
The Syndicate killed another one of our undercover operatives last week.
That makes five in the past year.
We need you to find out who their informant in Starfleet is. Once you give me the name, I'll put you on the next transport home.
What do you want me to do now?

Bilby will check into your background. Everything he finds will confirm that you're a fix-it man down on your luck. Stick to that cover. The Syndicate is always looking for people with your skills. If Bilby offers you more work, take it. Get as close to him as possible.
Right.
If you need anything, you know how to contact me.
O'Brien.
Don't take anymore unnecessary risks. These are dangerous men. If they find out who you are, they'll kill you.
Major, sorry to -- Excuse me, Major
After you. Go ahead.
There's something wrong with --
All right. You first, then you.
I need an engineering crew to run a diagnostic on the internal security sensors. We've been having an unusual number of false alarms lately.
I'll have someone take a look as soon as possible.
There's something wrong with the fire suppression system in the bar. Every time I serve a flaming cocktail, the system engages and snuffs it out.
I'll put it on the list.
Please do. You wouldn't believe what people are willing to pay for a glass of burning alcohol.
Excuse me, major --
Let me guess. There's a malfunction in the Infirmary.
How did you know?
Major, there is something wrong with the turbolift.
I can see that.
We seem to be having a lot of system glitches.
It happens every time Chief O'Brien goes away.
I do not understand why his staff can't keep the station running in his absence.
He must've left my idiot brother in charge.
The engineering crews are doing the best they can.
The problem is no one knows how the chief keeps all this Federation and Cardassian technology working together.
We've got to do something. This can't go on.
Sorry, I can't discuss the chief's whereabouts.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: I understand that, sir. But this is getting ridiculous. How much longer are we going to have to put up with these malfunctions?
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: You know, it wouldn't surprise me if Major Kira or Commander Worf came in here demanding answers. But you? It's not your style.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: Apparently it is. Here I am.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: I'm not buying it, doctor. You didn't come in here to complain, you came in here because you're worried about your friend and you want me to put your mind at ease.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: I wish I could. If it helps, I will tell you this -- the chief can take care of himself about as well as anyone I know.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: You're right about that, sir.
scene: 8B   INT. CAPTAIN'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON SISKO

quote: Did you fix it?
Any feedback?
Feedback gives him a headache.
There's no feedback.
We'll see.
I told you.
Very impressive. If I was a suspicious man, I might ask myself how a tinkerer living in one room on Jinami Street managed to fix such a complicated piece of hardware so quickly.
Good question.
How do you know where I live?
I know a lot about you. Maybe more than you want me to.
Come with me.
Where are we going?
For a walk.
Have a seat.
Not there.
Chester doesn't like people sitting in his chair.
Don't touch anything.
Something wrong?
You tell me.
Do you think I brought you here to kill you?
Why would I kill somebody who can fix things for me? I guess a man who's been knocked around as much as you have is always expecting the worst.
I've pretty much had to get used to the idea that I've got bad luck.
That was a tough break you had on Dayos Four -- two years for dealing in stolen goods.
I didn't know the stuff was stolen. I guess I should've asked the guy I bought it from, huh?

Who's to say he would've told you the truth? Take this for example. My employer asked me to get three Klingon disruptors for him. Did the man I bought them from tell me they didn't work? No, he did not. Have a look.
The induction coil is burned out.
Can you fix it?
Sure.
Glad to hear it. That's going to make my employer very happy.
What does he want with Klingon disruptors?
I didn't ask. When Raimus tells you to do something, you just do it. Hungry?
A little.
Have some cake. My wife sent it.
No, thanks.
Go ahead.
It's good.
She made it herself. (pointing out a FRAMED PICTURE) That's her. With my children.
Very nice. Where are they?
New Sydney. I'd love to have them here on Farius, but considering the business I'm in, it's not a good idea. Do you have a family?
No.
You should. It's the most important thing. (pointing to the picture) I send them everything. I pay my fare to Raimus, the rest goes straight to my wife.
Your "fare?"
To Raimus. Every month. That's how it works. He's above me in the organization.
You do know what organization I'm referring to, don't you?
I think so.
Good. Krole and Flith -- the gentlemen you met earlier, they're below me.
Lucky them.
If you fix these disruptors for me, you could be lucky, too.
That's good to know.
Don't misunderstand. I'm not making any promises. I need to be sure I can trust you first.
More cake?
No, thanks.
I thought you were hungry.
I'm all right.
What's the matter? You don't like my wife's cake?
I didn't say that.
Answer me. Do you like my wife's cake?
To tell you the truth, it's a little dry.
You're right. It is.
I had you wondering which way to jump, didn't I? Flith and Krole always act like it's the best thing they've ever tasted.
What do you make of that, Chester? I found myself an honest man. Must be my lucky day...
The induction coils you asked for. Courtesy of the Klingon Ambassador to Farius.
There's a Klingon Ambassador here? Gowron must not like him too much.
Do you have any idea why Raimus wants these disruptors?
Bilby doesn't even know.
Listen... is there any way I can talk to my wife, let her know I'm all right?
We can't risk it.
I'm sorry.
I'd better be going.
Flith, go stand over there.
Why?
I want to see if he really fixed this.
Very funny.
Contact Raimus and tell him we have the disruptors.
(to O'Brien; re: the disruptors) Good job.
I'm curious about something... how did you get a hold of replacement parts? Klingon technology isn't easy to come by.
You just have to know who to go to.
Why don't you enlighten us? In case we need to procure something else.
I have a better idea. Why don't you stay out of my business?
Tell us where you got the parts -- we can always use a good contact.
I can't.
Why not?
My supplier would rather remain anonymous.
I don't care what your supplier wants. I'm asking you a question.
I told him I wouldn't say.
Where'd you get the parts?
I stole them.
You stole them?
From a warehouse down on Degora Street.
Why didn't you just say so?
I thought it'd be better you didn't know -- in case the police catch up with me.
You lied to me so that I wouldn't be implicated?
I'm sorry.
Did you hear that? He was willing to protect me if he got caught. As hard as I try, I can't imagine either of you being willing to do that.
You know something? I think it's time we do something about the way you look.
What do you think?
He looks fine.
What are you talking about? I took him to the same tailor I use.
You look fine, too.
Nice handkerchief.
I understand you've been looking for me.
That's right.
I take it you're in the market for something.
If I was, I wouldn't buy it from the man who sold me three useless disruptors.
You know me better than that.
I thought I did.
Those disruptors were working fine when I gave them to you. What happened after that, I don't know. Maybe you dropped them.
I want my money back.
You know I can't do that. You took delivery.
Let me get something straight... you're telling me there was nothing wrong with this when you sold it to me?
That's correct.
Maybe I just don't know how to work it.
That must be it.
What do you know? I figured it out.
Bilby --
Do you know what would've happened if I'd given Raimus three useless disruptors? He would've killed me.
If you want your money back, you can have it...
Why would I want my money back? It works fine now.
No one takes me for a fool.
I will do whatever it takes to protect what I have.

This life... it's not for everyone. Sometimes I wish I could just get away from it all. But then, what would I do with myself? I'm too old to start over. Besides, who am I to complain? The organization has given me opportunities that I never thought I'd have. Once you're part of it, once you're accepted -- there are no limits to what you can do if you're smart about it.
Smart and careful.
I'm glad to see you're paying attention. We have people everywhere. Even Earth. Hell, we even have a man in Starfleet.
Come on. Starfleet?
That's correct.
Do me a favor. Remind me to pick up something for my daughter tomorrow. Her birthday's coming up.
Sure thing.
I'd like to be there. I hope I can get away.
How'd you manage to get to someone in Starfleet?
It wasn't me, it was Raimus. Do you want to come to New Sydney with me -- meet my family?
If you go, sure. How did he do it?
Why all the questions?
